alert.note: Alert for Logan; Thomas; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 5:28PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wallace, southern Thomas and Logan Counties through 515 PM MDT/615 PM CDT/... At 426 PM MDT/526 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Colby to 11 miles northwest of Monument to 7 miles northwest of Winona to 7 miles northwest of Wallace to 6 miles north of Weskan. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Winona around 545 PM CDT. Weskan around 445 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wallace, Monument, Oakley and Russell Springs. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 55 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong winds associated with these storms will result in areas of reduced visibility associated with blowing dust. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. Torrential rainfall with these storms may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
